{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode=Basketball |Year=2009-10 |Prev year=2008-09 |Next year=2010-11 |Team=Savannah State Tigers |Image= |Conference=NCAA Division I independent schools (basketball) |Division= I |ShortConference=Independent |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=11–15 |ConfRecord= |HeadCoach=[[Horace Broadnax]] |AsstCoach1=Jay Gibbons |AsstCoach2=Clyde Wormley |AsstCoach3= |StadiumArena=[[Tiger Arena]] |Champion= |BowlTourney= |BowlTourneyResult= }}The '''2009-2010 [[Savannah State Tigers men's basketball|Savannah State Tigers men's basketball team]]''' competed in American basketball on behalf of [[Savannah State University]]. The Tigers competed in the NCAA Division I as an independent and finished the season 11–15. The team played its home games at [[Tiger Arena]] in [[Savannah, Georgia]]. The Tigers entered the season seeking to improve on the 15–14 record posted in the 2008–09 season, the team's first winning season in 23 years.{{cite web|url=http://savannahnow.com/sports/2009-09-30/ssu-releases-mens-basketball-schedule|title=SSU releases men's basketball schedule|last=Barnidge|first=Noell|work=SavannahNow.com|publisher=Savannah Morning News and Evening Press|date=2009-09-30|accessdate=2009-09-30}} The fifteen victories were the most since the university moved to Division I in 2002. ==Season Notes== ===Coaching Staff=== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 90%;" |- |'''Name''' |'''Type''' |'''College''' |'''Graduating year''' |- | [[Horace Broadnax]] | Head Coach | [[Georgetown University]] | 1986 |- | Jay Gibbons | Assistant Coach | [[Clayton State University]] | 2003 |- | Clyde Wormley | Assistant Coach | [[The Citadel (military college)|The Citadel]] | 2003 |} ===2009-2010 Roster=== {| style="border:5px solid #0000FF;" cellspacing=8 |- align="center" bgcolor="#CC5500" |colspan=8|'''SSU Men's Basketball'''
